Name: Removing certain convictions from consideration for suspension from certain city employment.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to removing certain convictions from consideration for suspension from certain city employment.
BodyName: Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
This Introduction was Filed (End of Session)

Attachments.Name: Minutes of the Stated Meeting - April 11, 2018

Summary: This bill would encourage the commissioner to not consider any conviction for the offenses defined in sections 221.05, 221.10, or 221.15 of the penal law as the sole consideration for suspension of the sanitation uniformed force.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      Section 1. Subdivison a of section 16-106 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended to read as follows:
      a. The commissioner, in his or her discretion, shall have power to punish any member of the uniformed force who has been guilty of:
      1. any legal or criminal offense, except that conviction for the offenses defined in sections 221.05, 221.10, or 221.15 of the penal law may not be the sole factor in such punishment,
      2. neglect of duty,
      3. violation of rules,
      4. neglect or disobedience of orders,
      5. incapacity,
      6. absence without leave,
      7. conduct injurious to the public peace or welfare,
      8. immoral conduct, or
      9. any breach of discipline,
      ï¿½ 2. This local law takes effect immediately.
